headline: Kraft Mac and Cheese Tuna Casserole
description: When you combine packaged Kraft mac and cheese with a classic tuna casserole, the result is comfort food at its best.
name: Kraft Mac and Cheese Tuna Casserole
recipeIngredient: 1 (7.25 ounce) package macaroni and cheese dinner mix (such as KraftÂ®)
1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup
1 (5 ounce) can chunk light tuna, drained and flaked

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with nonstick spray.
Bring 6 cups water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Stir in macaroni from the box and cook for 7 minutes. Drain macaroni, then rinse under cold water and drain again. Set cheese sauce packet aside.
Melt butter in the same saucepan over medium heat. Add milk and cheese sauce packet; mix well. Stir in condensed soup and cook until heated through, about 3 minutes.
Combine drained macaroni, peas, and tuna in a bowl. Fold in the cheesy soup mixture. Pour mixture into the prepared baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with Cheddar cheese, then sprinkle French-fried onions over top. Bake until onions are brown and cheese is melted, another 5 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Delicious! I have been making tuna noodle casserole with Kraft Mac & Cheese for a long time but this has a delicious addition of extra cheese and crispy onions! Thank you
I liked it you can even try it with chopped Green Peppers try it its really delicious it gives it a nice crunch.
I made this recipe tonight. No tweaking necessary as it was perfectly delicious! Thank you for sharing.

This is such a good recipe! The crispy onion topping really adds a nice dimension to this casserole. I didn't have shredded cheddar, so I used a pizza blend cheese (mozzarella & cheddar). I also added a little garlic powder on top of the casserole for the last 5 minutes of cooking, because I love garlic. So yummy!

Very good and easy to make! I didn't have milk so I used 1\2 cup sour cream instead. Also added ground black pepper. Didn't have French-fried onions or the cheddar cheese, but it was still great. Will try making it again with onions and cheese. Thanks!
Very delicious I used bread crumbs instead of French fried onions.
Great, but there is no need to rinse your macaroni.

Great recipe. It's quick and easy. I used the deluxe Mac and cheese and added about a half cup of sour cream instead of using milk. Taste great. My family isn't really into tuna casserole, but they absolutely loved this recipe.

This is an excellent macaroni and cheese, tuna casserole. My wife said it was the best she has had. I did only one thing differently. I had the Kraft Deluxe Macaroni and Cheese product with the squeezable cheese packet. I only used 1/2 cup of milk instead of 3/4 cup. The casserole was excellent.

item.name: Kraft Mac and Cheese Tuna Casserole
